text: Elections to Chichester District Council in West Sussex, United Kingdom were held on 2 May 2019. The whole council was up for election and the Conservative Party had its majority wiped out. == Boundary changes == In 2016, the Local Government Boundary Commission for England presented its proposed boundary changes for the Chichester District, following a three month consultation with the public. This involved reducing the number of councillors from 48 to 36, and the number of wards from 29 to 21. {| class="wikitable" width="auto" |- ! colspan="6" | Boundary changes in effect from May 2019 |- style="background:#efefef;" ! style="text-align:center;" |Old wards ! style="text-align:center;" |New wards |- | Chichester East | rowspan="3" | Chichester Central‡ |- | Chichester North |- | Chichester South |- | Chichester East | rowspan="2" | Chichester East |- | Chichester North |- | Chichester North | rowspan="2" | Chichester North |- | Chichester West |- | Chichester South | rowspan="2" | Chichester South |- | Chichester East |- | Chichester West | rowspan="2" | Chichester West |- | Chichester South |- | Easebourne | rowspan="2" | Easebourne |- | Stedham* |- | Fernhurst | rowspan="3" | Fernhurst |- | Plaistow* |- | Rogate* |- | Bury* | rowspan="2" | Fittleworth‡ |- | Petworth |- | Boxgrove* | rowspan="2" | Goodwood‡ |- | Lavant |- | Bosham* | rowspan="4" | Harbour Villages‡ |- | Donnington* |- | Fishbourne* |- | Southbourne |- | Harting | rowspan="2" | Harting |- | Rogate* |- | Lavant | rowspan="2" | Lavant |- | Funtington* |- | Petworth | rowspan="3" | Loxwood‡ |- | Plaistow* |- | Wisborough Green* |- | Midhurst | rowspan="2" | Midhurst |- | Stedham* |- | North Mundham* | rowspan="3" | North Mundham and Tangmere‡ |- | Tangmere* |- | Sidlesham* |- | Petworth | Petworth |- | Selsey South | rowspan="2" | Selsey South |- | Selsey North* |- | Sidlesham* | rowspan="2" | Sidlesham with Selsey North‡ |- | Selsey North* |- | Southbourne | Southbourne |- | East Wittering* | rowspan="2" | The Witterings‡ |- | West Wittering* |- | Westbourne | rowspan="2" | Westbourne |- | Funtington* |- style="background:#efefef;" | style="text-align:right;" | * Abolished | style="text-align:right;" | ‡ New creation |} == Election result == {| style="width:100%;
